statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Northwestern St. 95, Nicholls State 93 (OT)
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Kerwin Forges scored 17 points -- and hit a pair of free throws in overtime -- as Northwestern State defeated Nicholls State 95-93 Thursday. Forges scored his final four points in overtime for the Demons (13-11, 7-3 Southland), who overcame a 14-point first-half deficit and an eight-point hole in the second half. Forges hit a pair of free throws with 3:16 left in overtime to put Northwestern up 87-86. That started a run of six straight points which gave the Demons a 91-86 lead with 1:35 to go. Nicholls didn't have a chance to take the lead until the final second, when Willie Depron's court-length heave missed the basket. But Depron's shooting kept the Colonels (6-16, 1-10) in front most of the game. He scored a career-high 32 points, hitting 5-of-7 3-pointers and adding 9-of-11 from the free throw line while recording a game-best 10 rebounds. Forges was one of six double-figure scorers for Northwestern. Clifton Lee scored 15, Byron Allen 13 and Jermaine Wallace 12. Tramaine Hancock and Alfonse Dyer each had 10. Jason Wilkins added 15 points for Nicholls. Shawn King finished with 14 and Cyril Djoukeng had 11. The Colonels led 81-77 with 52 seconds to go in regulation, but a 3-pointer from Tyronn Mitchell with 35 seconds remaining put them within one. Djoukeng hit the second of two free throws with 21 seconds to go, but Wallace was fouled nine seconds later and sank both free throws to force overtime.
